coli_erlang_reg.description: Keep fallback timer at configured value at upgrade.
Disable the check for maximum number of upgrade packages allowed to be installed. WARNING! Disabling this check can render the system unusable because of archive disk space exhaustion

Enable the check for maximum number of upgrade packages allowed to be installed. NOTE! If the check has been disabled, more than three upgrade packages may already be installed. After the check is reenabled, no packages can be installed until a sufficient number is removed.
Reset the quarantine for database disk commits.

Set the delay time for the delay of internal housekeeping of system created backups to any value in milliseconds. The preinstalled value is 3,600,000. Be sure to reset this value after testing. If the value is changed, this is noted in the SwmLog.
Reset the delay time for the delay of internal housekeeping of system created backups to the preinstalled value 3,600,000.
Set the timeout for the data conversion rollback timer.
Reset the rollback timeout to the preinstalled value.
Set the timeout for the backup restore cancel timer.
Reset the cancel timeout to the preinstalled value.

Triggers housekeeping of system created backups. System created backups which is not needed will be deleted. Export backups you want to keep to an external server. Invoking this command may leave hanging jobs in OSS.

Set the post-confirm upgrade time interval, in which fast restore to the previously installed UP is available.
[] Displays the current time setting
disable Disables the function if called before the 'confirm' action
infinity Enables the fast restore with no expiry date. WARNING! Running in fast restore may cause disk shortage and other limitations
Days Enables the period for a whole number of days
Ends the current post-confirm fast restore period immediately. This enables normal software management operations.

Enable or disable the confirmRestore timeout. Note: The value set when the backup was created is what makes the difference
[] Displays the current state
disable No timeout after restore. The restore is automatically confirmed.
enable Timeout according to the configured value in BrmRollbackAtRestore. The restore may be cancelled during the rollback period. Confirm is automatic at the end of the waiting period if OAM login is detected.
enable-hard Timeout according to the configured value in BrmRollbackAtRestore The restore may be cancelled during the rollback period. The restore is automatically cancelled at the end of the waiting period

Show the preinstalled HAL SW
[] Displays the HAL SW for current HwSwCompatibilityIndex
idx [HwSwCompatibilityIndex] Displays the HAL SW for the given HwSwCompatibilityIndex
all Displays all HAL SW on the board

If no option specified for this command, -status is assumed.
status Displays time remaining before auto confirm of new software signing certificate
timeoutconfig [GracefulPeriod] Change the timeout for auto confirm of new software signing certificate to anything from 0-14 days
timeoutreset Reset the timeout for auto confirm of new software signing certificate to default, 1 day
confirm Stop countdown and confirm the new software signing certificates

The activation complete attribute value change notification may sometimes be missed by the receiving upgrade management application (for example OSS/SHM). In this case the upgrade will timeout if it stays in WAITING_FOR_COMMIT state until the rollback timer expires.
This option will enable or disable automatic resendning of the messages involved as well as an opportunity to force a manual resending of the message.
This function is enabled by default
[] Display the current status (disabled | enabled)
once Manual resending of the activation complete message for the UP currently in WAITING_FOR_COMMIT state
disable Disables automatic resending
enable Enables automatic resending if it has once been disabled
